com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common

Class CertPathChecker

  • com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common.CertPathChecker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CertChecker

    public class CertPathChecker
implements CertChecker

    This certificate path checkers validates the certificate path by checking whether at least one path consists of the certificate type from the set of valid ones and ends with the root certificate passed in rootCert. Additionally, there is a support for the certificate revocation status validation that can be enabled by setting the checkRevocation flag.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CertPathChecker(java.security.cert.X509Certificate rootCert, boolean checkRevocation)
      This certificate path checkers validates the certificate path by checking whether at least one path consists of the certificate type from the set of valid ones and ends with the root certificate passed in rootCert. Additionally, there is a support for the certificate revocation status validation that can be enabled by setting the checkRevocation flag.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void check(java.util.List<? extends java.security.cert.CertPath> legalIdentitiesCertPaths, NonExistentClass validCertRoles)
      Walks through the provided certificate chain and asserts that at least one certificate in the chain has a role matching of the provided validCertRoles.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common.CertChecker

        check

    • Constructor Detail

      • CertPathChecker

        public CertPathChecker(java.security.cert.X509Certificate rootCert,
                       boolean checkRevocation)

        This certificate path checkers validates the certificate path by checking whether at least one path consists of the certificate type from the set of valid ones and ends with the root certificate passed in rootCert. Additionally, there is a support for the certificate revocation status validation that can be enabled by setting the checkRevocation flag.

        Parameters:
        rootCert - root certificate that this checker should use during the certificate paths validation
        checkRevocation - flag indicating whether or not the certificate revocation list status check should be performed.

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public void check(java.util.List<? extends java.security.cert.CertPath> legalIdentitiesCertPaths,
                  NonExistentClass validCertRoles)

        Walks through the provided certificate chain and asserts that at least one certificate in the chain has a role matching of the provided validCertRoles.

        Parameters:
        legalIdentitiesCertPaths - certificate paths of legal identities to be checked
        validCertRoles - allowed certificate roles
        Throws:
        - when ever the certificate chain is not valid

      • validate

        public java.security.cert.PKIXCertPathValidatorResult validate(java.security.cert.CertPath $receiver,
                                                               java.security.cert.TrustAnchor trustAnchor,
                                                               boolean checkRevocation)
